title: 15 Stylish Haircut Ideas for Men with Long Faces

steps.title: Crew cut
steps.content: Crew cut A crew cut is a simple, low-maintenance haircut that keeps the sides shorter than the top. It’s a clean look that pairs well with all types of face shapes , including long faces. If you have a longer face, try to avoid cutting the sides too short. If you don’t, you may risk accentuating the length of your head. How to Style: Apply pomade or wax to your hair using your fingers or a comb to add texture.

steps.title: Buzz cut
steps.content: Buzz cut No matter your hair type , a buzz cut can make other aspects of your face stand out, like your jawline or brow. If you want to draw attention away from your face length and highlight some of your other favorite facial features, go with a buzz cut. How to Style: Comb your hair to an equal length and brush it towards your hairline.

steps.title: Classic fade
steps.content: Classic fade The classic fade is a great haircut for long faces because of the sharp, short-cut sides and back, which gradually blend into a longer top. The long top balances out the length of your face while the short sides add a crisp, clean look. [1] X Research source How to Style: Work with a barber to determine the best type of fade , then apply gel to the top to add extra flair.

steps.title: Ivy League
steps.content: Ivy League The Ivy League haircut is a more sophisticated take on the crew cut, combining short sides with a taller top. The difference is that the Ivy League haircut adds a traditional side part, adding an extra dimension to the look. The Ivy League works well with long faces because the volume of hair past the part contrasts well with the face length. [2] X Research source How to Style: Run pomade through your hair to keep it in place.

steps.title: Undercut
steps.content: Undercut An undercut is a haircut that buzzes the back and sides or cuts them short while leaving length on top. It’s a versatile cut that works with straight, wavy, or permed hair. To make sure it’s best suited to your longer face shape, keep plenty of length on top so it takes attention away from your facial length. [3] X Research source How to Style: Use a blow dryer while combing the top to increase volume, then use gel to slick your hair towards the back.

steps.title: Pompadour
steps.content: Pompadour A pompadour is a great option because it draws attention away from the face length and towards the voluminous top. This iconic hairstyle has a short, slicked-back top that’s sure to make a statement for any long-haired chap. [4] X Research source How to Style: Use hair gel or pomade to slick the pompadour towards the back of your head and hold it in place. Pair your pompadour with a fade for an extra modern edge.

steps.title: Faux hawk
steps.content: Faux hawk A faux hawk is a wider mohawk that features a voluminous top with buzzed sides. The top typically faces upward, similar to a mohawk, adding extra length to your hair that helps balance out the length in your face. If you’re looking for a versatile haircut that you can rock in different lengths and styles, look into getting a faux hawk. [5] X Research source How to Style: Blow dry your hair towards the back, massaging pomade into your hair to enhance volume. Apply hairspray to keep your hair fixed in place.

steps.title: Fringe cut
steps.content: Fringe cut The fringe cut is a great option to go with. Master cosmetologist Shun Pittman says a fringe with the horizontal line going across the top reduces the length of a face shape, making it a great choice for those with longer or oblong faces. It’s also versatile, as the rest of your hair can be whatever length you’d like. How to Style: Apply sea salt spray to your hair, blow dry, and work texturizing powder into your hair to add more texture. Rock a boxed fringe, which is a boxed haircut with a fringe, paired with a fade to add some variety to your cut. When cutting your own bangs, master hairstylist Ambia Elms says to start by cutting less hair than you think you want to cut. Remember, you can always cut off more if you’d like, but you can’t add more length.

steps.title: Modern Spikes
steps.content: Modern Spikes The short sides blend into the long top, adding a seamless transition from your face to your hair. The spikes also add texture that takes attention away from your face, so rock this cut if you’re looking for a voluminous look filled with texture. How to Style: Blow dry your hair forward towards your forehead, then apply wax using your hands to create the spikes.

steps.title: Locs
steps.content: Locs Locs are an exciting protective hairstyle for natural hair that pairs extremely well with long faces. Whether you’re rocking short locs, afro locs, or long locs, the length and texture of loc styles are sure to draw attention away from the length of your face. Remember, though, locs are a lot to take care of. You need retwists to keep them looking fresh, so prepare for regular maintenance if you go with this look. How to Style: Put your locs into a bun or pigtails to keep them out of your face and switch up your look.

steps.title: Afro
steps.content: Afro If you’re a fan of the puffy look, go with an afro. Depending on the length of your afro, you’ll draw plenty of attention to your hair with this look. For a short afro, pair it with a lineup and a fade for a crispy look that complements your long face. For a long afro, a fade is optional, as it’ll contrast well with your long face regardless. How to Style: Pick your afro out to add more volume to your hair. Use a curl sponge to add texture to your hair.

steps.title: Layered haircut
steps.content: Layered haircut Getting a haircut with lots of layers adds volume to your hair and helps balance the proportions of your long face. You can get a long layered cut that adds volume all around, or go for a shorter look that only adds volume to the top. Whatever you decide, it’s sure to bring attention to your hair and away from your face.​​ [6] X Research source How to Style: Use sea salt spray to add more volume and texture.

steps.title: Combover
steps.content: Combover If you rock the classic combover, you get the benefits of added hair length, but it isn’t so tall that it elongates your face. Plus, you can comb it in different ways for different results, like upward and behind to show off your forehead, or to the side to keep the length short, yet voluminous. [7] X Research source How to Style: Add gel or pomade to keep your combover in place.

steps.title: Long hair
steps.content: Long hair If you’re looking to grow your hair out, you’re in luck, because long hair is great for people with long faces. It conceals the sides of your face and draws attention away from its length. Now, long hair can require a good amount of maintenance to remain soft, clean, and fresh, but that comes with the added benefit of versatility. So, if you’re ready to make that commitment, go with long hair. How to Style: Brush and comb your hair at least once a day. For curly long hair, apply a curling spray to hold your curls throughout the day.

steps.title: Curly bob
steps.content: Curly bob This short haircut is great for all genders, including men! It adds texture to your hair that helps offset the length of your face while not requiring too much maintenance. It combines a medium-length haircut with a fringe that covers part of the forehead, shortening the length of your face while keeping your messy look stylish. How to Style: Use a curling iron to make mini waves if you don’t have naturally curly hair. Use sea salt spray or texturizing spray to add more texture to your hair and make it pop out more.

steps.title: Grow a short beard or mustache.
steps.content: Grow a short beard or mustache. Growing some short facial hair can add width to the lower half of your face by covering up some parts and giving the illusion that it’s shorter, so experiment with your facial hair to see what style makes your face look shorter. Try box beards, short goatees , chin straps, and chevron mustaches , as they all make long faces look a bit shorter. Long beards can elongate your face shape, so keep the beard short.

steps.title: Wear hats.
steps.content: Wear hats. Certain types of hats, like bucket hats and baseball caps , are great for making long faces look shorter, as they cover up the forehead and only really show half of your face. To shorten your face with a hat, place it on ⅔ of your forehead, leaving room for your eyebrows so you can still express yourself. Choose a cap that pairs with your outfit so you look fresh and put together.

steps.title: Get cheek filler.
steps.content: Get cheek filler. Cheek fillers add volume to your cheeks and definition to your cheekbones, which can even out the width of your face and make it appear shorter. It can also make you appear more youthful, smooth out lines in your face, and plump up wrinkles. Different types of fillers do slightly different things, too, so ask your provider which one they’re using, depending on what you’re looking for. Types of fillers include: [8] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Hyaluronic acid (HA): The most common filler, this is a naturally occurring substance that exists in your skin. Use it to keep your skin hydrated and increase cheek volume. Calcium hydroxylapatite (CaHA): This naturally occurring substance exists in your bones. Providers use it to smooth out lines and wrinkles and add fullness to your cheekbones. Poly-L-lactic acid (PLLA): This synthetic substance helps your body make its own collagen. It’s typically used to treat deep cheek wrinkles. Polymethylmethacrylate (PMMA): These are small collagen beads that providers use to add firmness and structure to your cheeks, making them look firm and full.

steps.title: Measure your face to see if the length is longer than the width.
steps.content: Measure your face to see if the length is longer than the width. Compare the width of your face to the length of your face. If your face turns out to be longer in length than in width, whether it be slightly longer or twice the width, you have a long face. Measure the cheekbones, jawline, and forehead, too. If they all have the same measurements and your face is longer than it is wide, your face is oblong. [9] X Research source When choosing a haircut based on your face shape , makeup artist & stylist Frankie Sanderson says to determine your face shape beforehand so you don’t pick a haircut that clashes with it.

steps.title: Yes, because it allows you to be versatile in your hairstyles.
steps.content: Yes, because it allows you to be versatile in your hairstyles. A longer face has many options when it comes to hairstyles, including long hair, buzz cuts, pompadours, and more. You can also wear different types of hats to spice up your look, whereas round or triangle faces are more restricted in the types of looks that look good with them. There’s no such thing as a bad face shape, as it’s just the shape of your face! They come in all shapes and sizes and each comes with its own benefits and drawbacks.

steps.title: Men with long faces have tons of flattering hairstyles to choose from.
steps.content: Men with long faces have tons of flattering hairstyles to choose from. A long face pairs well with many different haircuts, from crew cuts and buzz cuts to Ivy Leagues and locs. If you don’t like any of the haircuts, you can always make your face look shorter by wearing a hat, growing a beard or mustache, or getting cheek filler. At the end of the day, though, faces come in all shapes and sizes, so embrace yours!
